aim4.voronoi

Class Edge

  • java.lang.Object
    • aim4.voronoi.Edge

  • public class Edge
extends java.lang.Object
    A single edge in a QuadEdge data structure.
    Author:
    Steven Benoit

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Vertex data
      data associated with the edge (origin vertex point)
      Edge invrotEdge
      the next edge of 4 (clockwise) in the edge QuadEdge
      Edge next
      the next edge counterclockwise from the origin vertex
      Edge rotEdge
      the next edge of 4 (counterclockwise) in the edge QuadEdge
      boolean voronoi
      data associated with the edge (origin vertex point)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Edge() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Edge connect(Edge edge2)
      Add a new edge connecting the destination of this edge to the origin of edge2 in such a way that all three have the same left face after the connection is complete.
      void delete()
      Deletes the edge, adjusting the references of surrounding edges as needed.
      Vertex dest()
      Gets the data associated with this edge's destination vertex.
      Edge dNext()
      Gets the next edge we find that enters this edge's destination vertex as we go around that vertex counterclockwise from this edge.
      Edge dPrev()
      Gets the next edge we find that enters this edge's destination vertex as we go around that vertex clockwise from this edge.
      Edge invRot()
      Gets the edge from the left face to the right face relative to this edge (think of this as the edge that is rotated -90 degrees from this edge).
      Vertex left()
      Gets the data associated with the face to the left of this edge.
      Edge lNext()
      Gets the edge that follows this edge in a counterclockwise traversal of the face to the left of this edge.
      Edge lPrev()
      Gets the edge that precedes this edge in a counterclockwise traversal of the face to the left of this edge.
      Edge oNext()
      Gets the next edge we find that leaves this edge's origin vertex as we go around that vertex counterclockwise from this edge.
      Edge oPrev()
      Gets the next edge we find that leaves this edge's origin vertex as we go around that vertex clockwise from this edge.
      Vertex org()
      Gets the data associated with this edge's origin vertex.
      Vertex right()
      Gets the data associated with the face to the right of this edge.
      Edge rNext()
      Gets the edge that follows this edge in a counterclockwise traversal of the face to the right of this edge (note that such a traversal goes opposite the direction of this edge).
      Edge rot()
      Gets the edge from the right face to the left face relative to this edge (think of this as the edge that is rotated 90 degrees from this edge).
      Edge rPrev()
      Gets the edge that precedes this edge in a counterclockwise traversal of the face to the right of this edge (note that such a traversal goes opposite the direction of this edge).
      void setEndPoints(Vertex org, Vertex dest)
      Sets the end points of this edge.
      static void splice(Edge edge1, Edge edge2)
      Implementation of the Splice topological primitive from Guibas and Stolfi (1985).
      void swap()
      Turns the edge counterclockwise inside its enclosing quadrilateral, updating data pointers appropriately.
      Edge sym()
      Gets the edge that connects the same two vertices as this edge, but with opposite orientation.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Generates the string representation of the edge.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

      • rot

        public Edge rot()
        Gets the edge from the right face to the left face relative to this edge (think of this as the edge that is rotated 90 degrees from this edge).
        Returns:
        the edge

      • invRot

        public Edge invRot()
        Gets the edge from the left face to the right face relative to this edge (think of this as the edge that is rotated -90 degrees from this edge).
        Returns:
        the edge

      • sym

        Gets the edge that connects the same two vertices as this edge, but with opposite orientation.
        Returns:
        the edge

        public Edge rNext()

        the edge

        Gets the edge that precedes this edge in a counterclockwise traversal of the face to the right of this edge (note that such a traversal goes opposite the direction of this edge).

      • setEndPoints

        public void setEndPoints(Vertex org,
                         Vertex dest)
        Sets the end points of this edge. The points of the dual space (faces) can be set using rotEdge().setEndPoints.
        Parameters:
        org - the origin vertex
        dest - the destination vertex

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Generates the string representation of the edge.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the string representation

      • splice

        public static void splice(Edge edge1,
                          Edge edge2)
        Implementation of the Splice topological primitive from Guibas and Stolfi (1985). If the two edges have the same origin vertex (they are parts of different loops that leave that vertex), the vertex is split. If the two edges have different origin vertices, those vertices are merged.
        Parameters:
        edge1 - the first edge
        edge2 - the second edge

      • delete

        public void delete()
        Deletes the edge, adjusting the references of surrounding edges as needed.

      • connect

        public Edge connect(Edge edge2)
        Add a new edge connecting the destination of this edge to the origin of edge2 in such a way that all three have the same left face after the connection is complete. The data pointers of the new edge are set to the appropriate vertices from the existing edges.
        Parameters:
        edge2 - the second edge
        Returns:
        the new edge

      • swap

        public void swap()
        Turns the edge counterclockwise inside its enclosing quadrilateral, updating data pointers appropriately.
